Get your music career on track

All of the tips and tools you need at any stage in your music career.

Resources for musicians

Project consultations
These days, being a musician also means being a manager, a booking agent, a publicist, and more. Thankfully, CION is here to help you figure it all out. Schedule a specialized one-on-one consultation with our Music Outreach Officer and get the tools and information you need.
Schedule a consultation
Music showcases
CION promotes Northern Ontario’s best and brightest through live music showcases and regional, provincial, and national events. Learn about your eligibility, the jury process, and how to apply.
Apply for a showcase
Professional Development
Our “NextPhase” Professional Development Opportunities are your chance to learn about the music industry through professional development seminars and workshops led by the best in the biz. We have in-person and on-demand webinars, and more – you can’t afford to miss these.
Find your next opportunity
Factor
FACTOR is dedicated to the growth and developement of the Canadian recording industry. Whether an artist is looking to record a demo, full-length sound recording, market and promote an already existing album, showcase, or tour, funding is available. Find out now!
See how Factor can help you
Resources and funding
A comprehensive listing of funding bodies, resources, summer festivals, and other organizations who promote, support, and book Northern Ontario musicians. You’ll want to bookmark this list!
See all resources and funding
Canadian Songwriter Challenge
10 Northern Ontario-based songwriters will be selected to spend the weekend participating in workshops, collaborative songwriting exercises and demo recording sessions with special guests.
Apply for the songwriter challenge

Tell us about yourself

Fill out our Inquiry form and get connected to our Music Outreach Officer for a one-on-one consultation. Let’s get this show on the road!

On the blog

On the blog
Hair and makeup assistant
TV Series in Sudbury, Ontario is currently seeking a Northern Ontario resident as hair and makeup assistant.
On the blog
Production Assistant
On the blog
Need a Scout?
Our approved location scouts know all of the lakes, mountains, and small towns
On the blog
Get to know mapped
The MAPPED program is a highly competitive production assistances fund. It provides on-the-job training to Northern Ontario residents looking to work in the industry.
